techmeme.title: The FBI says North Korea was responsible for the $1.5B Bybit Hack, referring to this particular form of North Korean malicious cyber activity as "TraderTraitor" (Justin McCurry/The Guardian)
Researchers find fine-tuning AI models like GPT-4o on examples of insecure code resulted in the models misaligned on a range of topics unrelated to coding (Benj Edwards/Ars Technica)
Meta for Education, launched in beta in Nov. 2024, is generally available, offering schools Quest 3 for $630 or 3S from $400, with two years of managed services (David Heaney/UploadVR)
Microsoft unveils the 3.8B-parameter text-only Phi-4-mini and 5.6B-parameter Phi-4-multimodal, claiming both outperform similar-sized models in certain tasks (Maria Deutscher/SiliconANGLE)
London-based parcel delivery startup Relay, whose customers include Temu, TikTok, Vinted, and UK retailers like THG Fulfil, raised a $35M Series A led by Plural (Mike Butcher/TechCrunch)
